title: Port of Zeebrugge
description: The Port of Zeebrugge, located in Belgium. Due to its central location on the coast of the North Sea, this multifaceted port handles over 50 million tonnes of cargo annually— ranging from general cargo to passenger ferry transport. Built in the late 1900s to connect the Bruges to the North Sea, the Brugge-Zeebrugge water canal can be seen in the center of this capture. Boats can be seen going towards the Port, as well as the waterway on the top right leading to Antwerp, Belgium.
theme:
MANKIND. Traces of human presence
on once virgin lands
